es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel
Class Simulation

java.lang.Object
  es.ull.iis.simulation.core.Simulation
      es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.Simulation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Debuggable, Describable, Identifiable, VariableStore, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Integer>
public class Simulation
extends Simulation

Main parallel discrete event simulation class. A simulation uses all kind of Simulation Objects to define a model which will be executed.

Two important simulation objects are activities and resource types. Both are grouped in different activity managers, which serve as an initial partition for parallelism.

The simulation is feed with discrete events produced by Basic elements.

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

Method Detail

run

public void run()
Starts the execution of the simulation. It creates and initializes all the necessary structures.

The following checks and initializations are performed within this method:

  1. If no customized debug output has been defined, the default one is used.
  2. If no customized AM creator has been defined, the default one is used.
  3. As many SlaveEventExecutor event executors as threads set by using Simulation.setNThreads(int) are created.
  4. The AMs are equally distributed among the available executors
  5. The user defined method Simulation.init() is invoked.
  6. Resources and generators are started.
  7. The main simulation loop is run
  8. The user defined method Simulation.end() is invoked.
The execution loop consists on waiting for the elements which are in execution, then the waiting events are executed (@see #execWaitingElements()} advanced and a new set of events is executed.
Also checks if a valid output for debug messages has been declared. Note that no debug messages can be printed before this method is declared unless setOutput had been invoked.

isSimulationEnd

public boolean isSimulationEnd()
Indicates if the simulation clock has reached the simulation end.

Returns:
True if the simulation clock is higher or equal to the simulation end. False in other case.

getTs

public long getTs()
Returns the current simulation time

Returns:
The current simulation time

addWait

public void addWait(BasicElement.DiscreteEvent e)
Sends an event to the waiting queue. An event is added to the waiting queue if its timestamp is higher than the simulation time.

Parameters:
e - Event to be added

printState

protected void printState()
Prints the current state of the simulation for debug purposes. Prints the current local time, the contents of the future event list and the execution queue.
